abstract: Afghan officials announce nominations for cabinet-level positions, ending three-month impasse between Pres Ashraf Ghani and chief executive Abdullah Abdullah over who will head government ministries; international officials welcome nominations, even as lengthy process has raised doubts about viability of government based on power-sharing agreement between Ghani and Abdullah.
lead_paragraph: Choosing a cabinet proved difficult for President Ashraf Ghani and his rival Abdullah Abdullah, who jointly lead the government.

byline.contributor: Jawad Sukhanyar contributed reporting from Kabul, and Taimoor Shah from Kandahar, Afghanistan.

snippet: Choosing a cabinet proved difficult for President Ashraf Ghani and his rival Abdullah Abdullah, who jointly lead the government.

headline.main: Strains Show as Afghan Leaders Announce Long-Awaited Cabinet Nominees
headline.print_headline: Strains Show as Afghan Leaders Announce Long-Awaited Cabinet Nominees
